topic_or_construct: learning and decision making under reward/punishment
justification: "Participants performed a four-armed restless bandit task with the goal of collecting happy smiley faces (rewards) and avoiding sad smiley faces (punishments) presented as feedback" – the task is used to capture how people learn from and decide after reward or punishment outcomes.

measured_by: threat of unpredictable electric shock paradigm (Threat condition)
justification: "To induce stress, participants were explicitly instructed that... electric shocks may be given at any time in the 'Threat' condition" – the shock-threat procedure serves as the operational measure of acute stress.

measured_by: punishment‐feedback-trend parameter in computational decision-weight model
justification: "The model including separate decision weights for punishment feedback trends was determined as the most likely model to explain the observed behaviors" – the specific parameter quantifies an individual’s tendency for impulsive avoidance following punishment.
